classic.title: Crime and Punishment
classic.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
classic.blurb: This classic novel is centered upon a poor law student's realisation that logic and human nature may be more incompatible than we assume.

classic.title: Moby Dick
classic.author: Herman Melville
classic.blurb: This classic novel is centered upon Captain Ahab and his obsessive mission to exact revenge on Moby Dick.

classic.title: War and Peace
classic.author: Leo Tolstoy
classic.blurb: This classic novel focuses on the impact of the French invasion of Russia through the eyes of five aristocratic families.

classic.title: Of Mice and Men
classic.author: John Steinbeck
classic.blurb: This classic novel follows the tragic lives of two friends who find work on a Californian ranch at the height of the Great Depression.

classic.title: Lord of the Flies
classic.author: William Golding
classic.blurb: This classic novel follows the disturbing story of a group of boys who become stranded on an island and attempt to govern themselves.

classic.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
classic.author: Harper Lee
classic.blurb: This classic novel is centered upon the relentless conviction of a lawyer to his client, who has been falsely accused of rape.

mystery.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
mystery.author: Stieg Larsson
mystery.blurb: The disappearance of a wealthy heiress leads her distressed uncle to hire a disgraced journalist to investigate.

mystery.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
mystery.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
mystery.blurb: Sherlock Holmes investigates an old legend that tells of how each heir of the wealthy Baskerville family is hunted and eventually murdered by a demonic hound.

mystery.title: Murder on the Orient Express
mystery.author: Agatha Christie
mystery.blurb: The world's greatest detective, is forced into a race against time to solve a sudden murder aboard a train.

romance.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
romance.author: E. L. James
romance.blurb: When a college senior covers an interview for her sick friend, little does she realise that she is about to be sucked into a relationship that is anything but conventional.

romance.title: The Notebook
romance.author: Nicholas Sparks
romance.blurb: Set in 1940s America, Noah and Allie are deeply in love, yet circumstances do not allow them to be together. Upon returning from war and with Allie on the brink of marriage to another man, they realise that they still love each other.

romance.title: The Fault in Our Stars
romance.author: John Green
romance.blurb: Two teenagers suffering from cancer embark on a journey of love, sadness and romance

romance.title: Me Before You
romance.author: Jojo Moyes
romance.blurb: A young woman who feels overshadowed by her sister finds work as the caretaker of a once-active quadriplegic man. Together, they grow closer and change each other's lives for the better.

romance.title: The Hating Game
romance.author: Sally Thorne
romance.blurb: Two colleagues who both despise each other, and are vying for a promotion, begin to realise that perhaps they may have misjudged each other.

scifi.title: Ender's Game
scifi.author: Orson Scott Card
scifi.blurb: Set in the future, immensely talented children are identified from young and trained in the art of warfare to defend Earth from an alien invasion.

scifi.title: Brave New World
scifi.author: Aldous Huxley
scifi.blurb: Set in the future, a single man challenges a new yet dystopian world order whereby humans are organised into an intelligence-based hierarchy.

scifi.title: The Martian
scifi.author: Andy Weir
scifi.blurb: A single astronaught, believed to have perished in a massive storm, is left on Mars by his crew. We follow his journey as he uses every ounce of his resourcefulness to try and survive.

scifi.title: The War of the Worlds
scifi.author: H. G. Wells
scifi.blurb: Told from the perspective of an unnamed protagonist and his brother, we hear of the events leading up to, as well as following from, a Martian invasion of Earth.
